recipe_instructions: 1. Wash and chop potatoes and sweet potatoes into small, even cubes. 2. In a large bowl, toss the potatoes and sweet potatoes with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 3. Spread the potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet. 4. Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 minutes, or until tender and slightly browned.
1. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. 2. Add chopped zucchini and mushrooms. 3. Sauté for about 5-7 minutes until softened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

1. Cook ditalini pasta according to package directions. 2. While pasta cooks, melt butter in a pan. 3. Add chopped parsley and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant. Season with salt and pepper. 4. Drain pasta and toss with the parsley butter sauce.
1. Heat the Hazel creamer in a saucepan. 2. Add the chopped cilantro to the warm creamer. 3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

1. Heat a little olive oil in a pan. 2. Warm the tortillas on both sides until heated through. 3. Fill the tortillas with the cooked vegetables (zucchini and mushrooms) and top with a dollop of the Cho yogurt for a simple veggie wrap.
